intro: Gouania stipularis, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Gouania stipularis is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
